issue.title: Support a split filter, counterpart to join filter

repository.name: jinja
repository.description: A very fast and expressive template engine.

issue.body: Like previous pull request, this gives a bit more in-template logic leeway, my use case being salt templates, where "just put it in the view function" is not convenient.

body: @pas256 Mind submitting a PR with your suggested improvements?

It's hard to say what would be a good writeup of the issue. The documentation says things like

> …don’t use builtin Python constructs such as str.format or the string modulo operator (%).

That clearly imply it's _possible_ to use builtin Python constructs (such as the ever popular `str.split`), but afaict it's never explicitly said anywhere that such Python constructs are allowed.

The thing is, if any Python construct is allowed (and it ought to be, given that Jinja falls back to `__getitem__`) then the documentation should probably just say that.

I was already using python methods in my jinja from having run across examples, but I just realized that it wasn't just the few I was already using. This is huge, and opens doors I didn't know existed. There should be a dedicated section with examples.

issue.title: Document use of python methods in jinja

repository.name: salt
repository.description: Software to automate the management and configuration of infrastructure and applications at scale.

issue.body:
### What does this PR do?
It adds to the Salt jinja documentation mention of a the use of python methods on variables. This is lacking in the official Jinja documentation, and is an open issue, https://github.com/pallets/jinja/issues/273 . Even the salt documentation hints at it, but doesn't call it out.

issue.title: adds documentation on use of python methods in expressions

repository.name: jinja
repository.description: A very fast and expressive template engine.
